rules.rule_text_en: Use at for clock times, on for days/dates, and in for months, years, seasons and longer periods.
rules.rule_text_uk: Використовуйте at для часу на годиннику, on для днів/дат, а in — для місяців, років, сезонів і довших періодів.
rules.rule_short_en: at 7.30 • on Friday/3 May • in June/2024
rules.rule_short_uk: at 7:30 • on Friday/3 May • in June/2024
examples: The lesson starts at 8.15.
My birthday is on 14 July.
She moved here in 2020.

rules.rule_text_en: Use at in some time expressions: at the moment, at the same time, at weekends, at Christmas; but usually in the morning/afternoon/evening and at night.
rules.rule_text_uk: У деяких сталих виразах з часом вживаємо at: at the moment, at the same time, at weekends, at Christmas; але зазвичай in the morning/afternoon/evening і at night.
rules.rule_short_en: at the moment • at weekends • in the morning • at night
rules.rule_short_uk: at the moment • at weekends • in the morning • at night
examples: I'm busy at the moment.
We often meet at weekends.
I sleep badly at night.

rules.rule_text_en: With parts of the day and days together, use on: on Monday morning, on Friday evening, on the afternoon of 5 June.
rules.rule_text_uk: Коли поєднуємо день і частину дня, вживаємо on: on Monday morning, on Friday evening, on the afternoon of 5 June.
rules.rule_short_en: on Monday morning / on Friday evening
rules.rule_short_uk: on Monday morning / on Friday evening
examples: The call is on Tuesday afternoon.
We had dinner on Friday evening.

rules.rule_text_en: We usually don’t use at/on/in before next, last, this, every: next week, last Friday, this morning, every day.
rules.rule_text_uk: Зазвичай не вживаємо at/on/in перед next, last, this, every: next week, last Friday, this morning, every day.
rules.rule_short_en: next week • last Friday • this morning • every day
rules.rule_short_uk: next week • last Friday • this morning • every day
examples: I'll see you next Monday.
She phoned me this morning.
We train every day.

rules.rule_text_en: Use in to say how long until something happens: in ten minutes (= ten minutes from now).
rules.rule_text_uk: Використовуйте in, щоб сказати, через скільки щось станеться: in ten minutes (= через 10 хвилин).
rules.rule_short_en: in ten minutes = ten minutes from now
rules.rule_short_uk: in ten minutes = через 10 хвилин
examples: The train leaves in five minutes.
I'll be ready in half an hour.

rules.rule_text_en: On time means ‘at the planned time’. In time means ‘early enough’. Just in time means ‘at the last possible moment’.
rules.rule_text_uk: On time означає «в запланований час». In time — «достатньо рано». Just in time — «в останній момент».
rules.rule_short_en: on time (scheduled) • in time (early enough) • just in time
rules.rule_short_uk: on time (за розкладом) • in time (встигнути) • just in time (в останню мить)
examples: The bus arrived on time.
We left early to get there in time.
I caught the lift just in time.

rules.rule_text_en: At the end (of something) is about time/position: at the end of the film. In the end means ‘finally / after a long time’.
rules.rule_text_uk: At the end (of something) — про кінець події/періоду: at the end of the film. In the end означає «зрештою / врешті-решт».
rules.rule_short_en: at the end of the film • in the end = finally
rules.rule_short_uk: at the end of the film • in the end = зрештою
examples: At the end of the meeting we agreed on a plan.
We argued a lot, but in the end we decided to go.

rules.rule_text_en: Use in for an enclosed space or area: in a room, in a building, in a town, in a garden, in the water.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживайте in для замкненого простору або території: in a room, in a building, in a town, in a garden, in the water.
rules.rule_short_en: in a room/building/town/garden/water
rules.rule_short_uk: in a room/building/town/garden/water
examples: She’s waiting in the kitchen.
I grew up in a small town.
The kids are playing in the water.

rules.rule_text_en: Use at for a point or place seen as a spot: at the station, at the bus stop, at the door, at the corner.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживайте at для точки/місця як «пункту»: at the station, at the bus stop, at the door, at the corner.
rules.rule_short_en: at the station/door/corner
rules.rule_short_uk: at the station/door/corner
examples: Meet me at the entrance.
There’s a café at the corner.

rules.rule_text_en: Use on for a surface or line: on the table, on the wall, on the floor, on the page, on the left/right.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживайте on для поверхні або лінії: on the table, on the wall, on the floor, on the page, on the left/right.
rules.rule_short_en: on the table/wall/page • on the left/right
rules.rule_short_uk: on the table/wall/page • on the left/right
examples: Your keys are on the desk.
There’s a photo on the wall.
Write your name on the form.

rules.rule_text_en: Use in with lines/rows/groups and with things that have an ‘inside’ space: in a queue, in a row, in a department, in a picture, in the sky.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживайте in з рядами/чергами/групами та з тим, що має «всередині»: in a queue, in a row, in a department, in a picture, in the sky.
rules.rule_short_en: in a queue/row • in a picture • in the sky
rules.rule_short_uk: in a queue/row • in a picture • in the sky
examples: We stood in a long queue.
I noticed a detail in the picture.
There were dark clouds in the sky.

rules.rule_text_en: Use on for lists/screens and for things on a line or edge: on the left/right, on a map, on a website, on a river/road/coast, on the way.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживайте on для списків/екранів і для того, що лежить «на лінії/краї»: on the left/right, on a map, on a website, on a river/road/coast, on the way.
rules.rule_short_en: on a map/website • on the coast • on the way
rules.rule_short_uk: on a map/website • on the coast • on the way
examples: Your name is on the list.
The village is on the coast.
We stopped on the way home.

rules.rule_text_en: Use at for the top/bottom/end of something: at the top, at the bottom, at the end of the street.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживайте at для верху/низу/кінця чогось: at the top, at the bottom, at the end of the street.
rules.rule_short_en: at the top/bottom • at the end of the street
rules.rule_short_uk: at the top/bottom • at the end of the street
examples: There’s a pharmacy at the end of this street.
The title is at the top of the page.

rules.rule_text_en: For front/back: at the front/back of a building (part of it), in the front/back of a car (inside), and on the front/back of paper or a photo.
rules.rule_text_uk: Для front/back: at the front/back of a building (частина), in the front/back of a car (всередині), і on the front/back of паперу або фото.
rules.rule_short_en: at the front of a building • in the back of a car • on the back of a photo
rules.rule_short_uk: at the front of a building • in the back of a car • on the back of a photo
examples: There’s a garden at the back of the house.
Sit in the back of the taxi.
My address is on the back of the card.

rules.rule_text_en: Use in the corner for inside corners (a room). Use at/on the corner for street corners (a corner point).
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживайте in the corner для внутрішнього кута (кімнати). At/on the corner — для рогу вулиць (точка).
rules.rule_short_en: in the corner (room) • at/on the corner (street)
rules.rule_short_uk: in the corner (кімната) • at/on the corner (вулиця)
examples: There’s a plant in the corner of the room.
The bank is at the corner of King Street and Park Road.

rules.rule_text_en: Some places use in: in bed, in hospital, in prison. But we usually say at home, at work, at school/university.
rules.rule_text_uk: Деякі місця вживаються з in: in bed, in hospital, in prison. Але зазвичай кажемо at home, at work, at school/university.
rules.rule_short_en: in bed/hospital/prison • at home/work/school
rules.rule_short_uk: in bed/hospital/prison • at home/work/school
examples: She’s still in bed.
My brother is in hospital.
I’ll be at work till six.

rules.rule_text_en: Use at for events and meeting places: at a party, at a concert, at a station/airport, at the doctor’s / hairdresser’s.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживайте at для подій і місць зустрічі: at a party, at a concert, at a station/airport, at the doctor’s / hairdresser’s.
rules.rule_short_en: at a party/concert • at the station • at the doctor’s
rules.rule_short_uk: at a party/concert • at the station • at the doctor’s
examples: We met at a conference.
I’ll see you at the station.
She’s at the dentist’s.

rules.rule_text_en: With buildings, use at when you mean ‘the place’ and in when you mean ‘inside’: at the cinema (= place), in the cinema (= inside).
rules.rule_text_uk: З будівлями: at — коли маємо на увазі «місце», in — коли «всередині»: at the cinema / in the cinema.
rules.rule_short_en: at the cinema (place) • in the cinema (inside)
rules.rule_short_uk: at the cinema (місце) • in the cinema (всередині)
examples: Let’s meet at the theatre.
It was hot in the theatre.

rules.rule_text_en: Transport: on a bus/train/plane/bike, but in a car/taxi. Get into/out of a car; get on/off a bus.
rules.rule_text_uk: Транспорт: on a bus/train/plane/bike, але in a car/taxi. Get into/out of a car; get on/off a bus.
rules.rule_short_en: on a bus/train/plane • in a car/taxi
rules.rule_short_uk: on a bus/train/plane • in a car/taxi
examples: We met on the train.
She was in a taxi.
He got on the bus quickly.

rules.rule_text_en: In/at with towns: in a town/city (within it), but at a town when it’s a stop on a journey.
rules.rule_text_uk: In/at з містами: in a town/city (в межах міста), але at a town як зупинка в дорозі.
rules.rule_short_en: in Paris (in the city) • stop at Paris (as a stop)
rules.rule_short_uk: in Paris (у місті) • stop at Paris (як зупинка)
examples: We spent a week in Lisbon.
The train stopped at a small town on the way.

rules.rule_text_en: Go/come/travel to a place. Arrive in a country/city and arrive at a building or point. Get to = reach.
rules.rule_text_uk: Go/come/travel to a place. Arrive in — країна/місто; arrive at — будівля або точка. Get to = дістатися.
rules.rule_short_en: go to • arrive in (city) • arrive at (airport) • get to
rules.rule_short_uk: go to • arrive in (місто) • arrive at (аеропорт) • get to
examples: We went to Spain last summer.
They arrived in Rome at noon.
I arrived at the hotel late.

rules.rule_text_en: Home: go home / come home (no preposition). But: be at home, stay at home.
rules.rule_text_uk: Home: go home / come home (без прийменника). Але: be at home, stay at home.
rules.rule_short_en: go home (no ‘to’) • be/stay at home
rules.rule_short_uk: go home (без ‘to’) • be/stay at home
examples: I’m going home now.
We stayed at home all evening.

rules.rule_text_en: Into shows movement to the inside: go into a room, put something into a bag. Compare: in = position, into = movement.
rules.rule_text_uk: Into показує рух усередину: go into a room, put something into a bag. Порівняйте: in = місце, into = рух.
rules.rule_short_en: into = movement inside • in = position
rules.rule_short_uk: into = рух усередину • in = місце
examples: She walked into the kitchen.
Put the keys into your pocket.

rules.rule_text_en: Other movement prepositions: out of, off, on, etc. (get out of a car, take something off a shelf, put it on).
rules.rule_text_uk: Інші прийменники руху: out of, off, on тощо (get out of a car, take something off a shelf, put it on).
rules.rule_short_en: out of / off / on + movement
rules.rule_short_uk: out of / off / on + рух
examples: He got out of the taxi.
She took the book off the shelf.

rules.rule_text_en: Use in for some conditions and states: in the rain/sun/dark, in a language, in cash, in love, in my opinion.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживайте in для умов і станів: in the rain/sun/dark, in a language, in cash, in love, in my opinion.
rules.rule_short_en: in the rain • in English • in love • in my opinion
rules.rule_short_uk: in the rain • in English • in love • in my opinion
examples: We got soaked in the rain.
The instructions are in English.
In my opinion, it’s too expensive.

rules.rule_text_en: Use on for media and activities: on TV, on the radio, on the phone, on the internet; and on holiday / on business / on a trip.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживайте on для медіа й активностей: on TV, on the radio, on the phone, on the internet; а також on holiday / on business / on a trip.
rules.rule_short_en: on TV/radio/phone • on holiday/on business
rules.rule_short_uk: on TV/radio/phone • on holiday/on business
examples: I saw it on TV.
She spoke to me on the phone.
They’re on holiday this week.

rules.rule_text_en: Use at for age, speed and some fixed phrases: at 16, at 80 km/h, at the same time, at the moment.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживайте at для віку, швидкості та деяких сталих виразів: at 16, at 80 km/h, at the same time, at the moment.
rules.rule_short_en: at 16 • at 80 km/h • at the same time
rules.rule_short_uk: at 16 • at 80 km/h • at the same time
examples: He left home at 18.
The car was travelling at 90 km/h.

rules.rule_text_en: On time (Unit 122) is different from at the time: at the time = then / at that period.
rules.rule_text_uk: On time (Unit 122) відрізняється від at the time: at the time = тоді / у той період.
rules.rule_short_en: at the time = then (not ‘on time’)
rules.rule_short_uk: at the time = тоді (не ‘on time’)
examples: I didn’t like the job at the time, but I do now.
At the time, we didn’t have a car.

rules.rule_text_en: Use by to say how you do something (method): by car, by bus, by train, by plane; by phone/email; by hand.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживайте by, щоб сказати, як щось робиться (спосіб): by car/bus/train/plane; by phone/email; by hand.
rules.rule_short_en: by car/bus • by email/phone • by hand
rules.rule_short_uk: by car/bus • by email/phone • by hand
examples: I usually go to work by bus.
Send the file by email.
The dress was made by hand.

rules.rule_text_en: By can also mean ‘not later than’ with time: by 5 o’clock, by Monday. (= at or before).
rules.rule_text_uk: By також означає «не пізніше ніж» з часом: by 5 o’clock, by Monday (= до або раніше).
rules.rule_short_en: by 5 p.m. = at or before 5 p.m.
rules.rule_short_uk: by 17:00 = до або раніше 17:00
examples: Please reply by Friday.
I’ll finish it by tomorrow morning.

rules.rule_text_en: Use by to say who/what does an action in the passive, and to say who created something: a book by…, a painting by…
rules.rule_text_uk: By також вживається для виконавця дії в пасиві та автора/творця: a book by…, a painting by…
rules.rule_short_en: opened by… • a novel by…
rules.rule_short_uk: opened by… • роман автора…
examples: The window was broken by the wind.
It’s a novel by Kazuo Ishiguro.

rules.rule_text_en: With by + -ing, it can show the means: You can improve by practising; He solved it by calling a friend.
rules.rule_text_uk: Конструкція by + -ing показує спосіб: You can improve by practising; He solved it by calling a friend.
rules.rule_short_en: by + -ing = by doing something
rules.rule_short_uk: by + -ing = роблячи щось
examples: I saved money by cooking at home.
She learned quickly by asking questions.

rules.rule_text_en: By can express difference/amount: by ten minutes, by two euros, by 3%.
rules.rule_text_uk: By може виражати різницю/наскільки: by ten minutes, by two euros, by 3%.
rules.rule_short_en: win by 2 points • late by 10 minutes
rules.rule_short_uk: виграти на 2 очки • запізнитися на 10 хв
examples: We won by two goals.
The train was late by fifteen minutes.

rules.rule_text_en: Many nouns take for: a reason for, a need for, a demand for, an excuse for.
rules.rule_text_uk: Багато іменників вживаються з for: a reason for, a need for, a demand for, an excuse for.
rules.rule_short_en: reason for • need for • demand for • excuse for
rules.rule_short_uk: reason for • need for • demand for • excuse for
examples: There’s no reason for panic.
Is there any need for a meeting?

rules.rule_text_en: Some nouns take of: the cause of, an advantage of, a photo/map of something.
rules.rule_text_uk: Деякі іменники вживаються з of: the cause of, an advantage of, a photo/map of something.
rules.rule_short_en: cause of • advantage of • a photo of
rules.rule_short_uk: cause of • advantage of • фото чогось
examples: The cause of the problem is unclear.
She showed me photos of her trip.

rules.rule_text_en: Some nouns take in: an increase in, a rise in, a fall in, a decrease in (prices, numbers, etc.).
rules.rule_text_uk: Деякі іменники вживаються з in: an increase in, a rise in, a fall in, a decrease in (ціни, кількість тощо).
rules.rule_short_en: increase in • rise in • fall in • decrease in
rules.rule_short_uk: increase in • rise in • fall in • decrease in
examples: There was a rise in prices.
We saw a fall in sales.

rules.rule_text_en: Some nouns take to: damage to, an invitation to, a solution to, a key to, an answer/reply to, a reaction to, an attitude to/towards.
rules.rule_text_uk: Деякі іменники вживаються з to: damage to, an invitation to, a solution to, a key to, an answer/reply to, a reaction to, an attitude to/towards.
rules.rule_short_en: solution to • key to • reaction to • attitude to
rules.rule_short_uk: solution to • key to • reaction to • attitude to
examples: We need a solution to this problem.
His reaction to the news surprised me.

rules.rule_text_en: With and between: a relationship with somebody; a connection between two things; a difference between A and B.
rules.rule_text_uk: З with і between: a relationship with somebody; a connection between two things; a difference between A and B.
rules.rule_short_en: relationship with • connection between • difference between
rules.rule_short_uk: relationship with • connection between • difference between
examples: I have regular contact with my colleagues.
There’s a big difference between the two plans.

rules.rule_text_en: We say it’s nice/kind/etc. of somebody to do something, but nice/kind/etc. to somebody when we describe behaviour towards them.
rules.rule_text_uk: Кажемо it’s nice/kind/etc. of somebody to do something, але nice/kind/etc. to somebody — коли описуємо ставлення до людини.
rules.rule_short_en: nice of you to help • nice to me
rules.rule_short_uk: nice of you to help • nice to me
examples: It was generous of her to pay.
They’re always friendly to visitors.

rules.rule_text_en: Some adjectives take about and with: angry/annoyed about something; angry/annoyed with somebody (often for doing something).
rules.rule_text_uk: Деякі прикметники вживаються з about і with: angry/annoyed about something; angry/annoyed with somebody (часто for doing something).
rules.rule_short_en: angry about the delay • angry with him
rules.rule_short_uk: angry about the delay • angry with him
examples: I’m upset about the mistake.
She was angry with me for being late.

rules.rule_text_en: Other common patterns: surprised at/by, impressed with/by, fed up/bored with, tired of.
rules.rule_text_uk: Інші поширені моделі: surprised at/by, impressed with/by, fed up/bored with, tired of.
rules.rule_short_en: surprised at/by • impressed with/by • bored with • tired of
rules.rule_short_uk: surprised at/by • impressed with/by • bored with • tired of
examples: We were amazed at the view.
I’m tired of arguing.

rules.rule_text_en: Sorry about a situation/event; sorry for doing something; feel sorry for somebody (pity).
rules.rule_text_uk: Sorry about — про ситуацію/подію; sorry for — за те, що зробив; feel sorry for — співчувати комусь.
rules.rule_short_en: sorry about the mess • sorry for shouting • sorry for him
rules.rule_short_uk: sorry about the mess • sorry for shouting • sorry for him
examples: Sorry about yesterday.
I’m sorry for interrupting.
I feel sorry for her.
